 Expanded/Free Access during COVID-19 Closure: Other Ebooks

 Finding Books
                                 
 
 
 
 The best place to find books is still the UCR Library Catalog.  The links on this page go to publishers and vendors offering books that are temporarily available, and would not be in the catalog. 
 
 
 UCR Library Catalog 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Project Muse
                                 
 
 
 
 
 Project MUSE   We have recently licensed a significant number of 2017-2020 university press books through Project Muse.  Some of these may not yet be in our catalog. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Google Books
                                 
 
 
 
 Google Books  is not providing additional access, but could be a good resource if what you are looking for is 
 
 A portion of a book 
 In the public domain 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Hathitrust Emergency Temporary Access Service
                                 
 
 
 
 
 HathiTrust 
	UCR faculty and students can access a significant portion of materials owned by UC Libraries through the  HathiTrust Emergency Temporary Access Service .  Log in before searching, and search catalog or the "Temporary Access" titles will not show up in the results.  It is not possible to download temporary access titles. 
 
 Books that are in the ETAS are unfortunately not eligible for curbside pickup. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 JSTOR
                                 
 
 
 
 
 JSTOR   Because we already license content through JSTOR, they are making the rest of their journal content available to UCR users through June 2021. 
 
Enable VPN to access 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 DeGruyter - UC Press
                                 
 
 
 
 We have recenlty purchased the entire historical collection of  UC press from DeGruyter  which may not yet be in our catalog. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Internet Archive Open Library
                                 
 
 
 
 The Internet Archive Open Library  is a collection of books available on a limited basis. 
 UCR does not license or subscribe to this resource, as it is openly available. However, it is a significant collection and worth mentioning.  It is also a little complicated to use, so  this guide  might be helpful. 
 Books are available to "borrow" and read once one has created an account and logged in.  However, downloading books requires users to utilize DRM software such as Adobe Digital Editions or Bluefire. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 How to Connect from off Campus
                                 
 
 
 
 Before you begin your research, connect to the Library. 
 
 Install the  GlobalProtect VPN 
 URL: campusvpn.ucr.edu  
 Sign in: NetID and Password 
 Verify: Using  Multi-factor Authentication (MFA)   
 Use: Open any browser and access library resources 
 Pin GlobalProtect somewhere easy to access 
 
 
 
 Connecting from Off Campus 
 Our LibGuide for in-depth instructions on remote access
